title: Typical JRPG Final Boss

fields.name: Abilities:
fields.value:
- Perform a regular attack with an overly long animation, attacking someone with your attack power
- Cast a party-wide magic attack, attacking a player and up to both of their alive neighbors with a basic attack
- Summon a meteor swarm and blow up the whole world, reducing everyone else's HP to one. (If they are Hellbent, they are now one damage away from dying, unless they already are, in which case they die instead. If they aren't Hellbent, their defense is set to None tonight and tomorrow night.) Single use. Only usable if your health is 40000 or less.

fields.name: Attributes:
fields.value:
- You take damage equal to the attack level of any attack on you plus one times 2000, to a maximum of 9999. (Non-attack/None - 2000, Basic - 4000, Powerful - 6000, Unstoppable - 8000, Overkill+ - 9999)  Damage from non-standard attack levels are determines by the host
- You take 20000 damage if you are executed instead of dying
- Once your health drops below 40000, the town is informed "You hear a bellowing cry throughout the town. The Nightmare is nearly over... or is it? Have resolve.". Your attack level raises to Unstoppable.

fields.name: Goal:
fields.value: Eliminate all the Heroes that oppose you (NK Goal)

desc:
Post 5221
*Why do attacks in JRPGs always do like, thousands of damage?*
